titlestmt.subtitle: Records, 1846-1962, of D. Appleton-Century Company at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlestmt.author: Electronic finding aid encoded by Beth Benda.

profiledesc.creation:
XML finding aid derived from HTML version through cutting and pasting.

Finding aid encoded by Beth Benda, Lilly Library, Indiana University, June 23, 2004

change.item: EAD id changed from InU-Li-LMC1023 to InU-Li-VAA1233
File name changed from AppletonCentury to InU-Li-VAA1233

Updates made to finding aid per Sheryl B.: editorial changes made to scope and content note and typos have been corrected in the container list as well as some rearrangement of folder names (oversized has been removed and made into Box 27). Finding aid also updated per IU EAD Report Card.

titlepage.publisher: Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlepage.p: © 2004 Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: Consists of the office files of the publishing company, its two predecessors, D. Appleton & Co., and the Century Co., and to a small extent its successor, Appleton-Century Crofts, Inc. The papers in the collection consist of contracts with authors for the publication of their works, and for dramatizations, motion picture rights, foreign editions, and translations of books published by the firm; business correspondence with authors, executors of their estates, publishers and others; royalty statements; copies of the wills of some of the authors; and other business papers.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: D. Appleton & Co. was founded in 1825 by Daniel Appleton who in that year opened a general store which featured books among other things. In 1831 he began to publish books. In 1933 this company merged with the Century Co., founded in 1881, to form the D. Appleton-Century Co. A consolidation of this company with the F.S. Crofts Co., founded in 1924, was effected in 1948 under the name Appleton-Century-Crofts, Inc. In 1960 this firm was bought by the Meredith Publishing Co., but the name was not changed.

arrangement.head: Arrangement/Organization
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by author or illustrator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The papers in the collection consist of contracts with authors for the publication of their works, and for dramatizations, motion picture rights, foreign editions, and translations of books published by the firm; business correspondence with authors, executors of their estates, publishers and others; royalty statements, copies of the wills of some of the authors; and other business papers.

The collection also contains a letter from Ulysses Simpson Grant to J.H. Work, December 22, 1881; corrected galley proof of Bess Streeter Aldrich's A lantern in her hand, and Miss Bishop; galley and page proofs of Edith Wharton's Age of innocence, and A backward glance; photographs of Edith Wharton and Harold Bell Wright; and printed promotional material (both unbound and mounted in 7 scrapbooks) for Harold Bell Wright's books.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Appleton-Century mss, Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by author or illustrator.
